{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3598452,"name":"4391 Programming Mentor","username":"aveeser","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/3da27b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-21T13:45:46.013Z","cooked":"

Our team used two limelight cameras this year - one LL3G for april tags and one “standard” LL3 that we used for pole detection. Each camera was plugged into an aux port on our radio with CAT6 cabling. Not using POE and no other ethernet items so didn’t need another switch. Every now and then (maybe like 5% of the time), one camera or the other would not establish ethernet comms. Little blinky LEDs on radio and camera ports wouldn’t even light up. Power cycling the camera, or simply unplugging the ethernet cable and plugging it back in would result in comms coming up as normal. What I found strange was that if we went the route of unplugging/plugging the ethernet cable, the amount of time it took to have connection established seemed the same as if we did a full power cycle of the camera. Anyone else fight this? Is there something we’re supposed to be doing for NT4 connections that we’re not doing?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-21T13:45:46.013Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":173,"readers_count":172,"score":38.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":499984,"topic_slug":"limelights-occasionally-not-connecting-ethernet","display_username":"4391 Programming Mentor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56643,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3598558,"name":"Clayton Colburn","username":"Clayton_Colburn","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/ccd318/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-21T15:05:03.695Z","cooked":"

We ran into an similar issue but it was more like 50% of the time one of our two limelights wouldn’t connect on the field. We tried everything we could think of, POE and no POE, automatic and static IP and nothing seemed to help. The only way we resolved it was to use a network switch. Our conclusion is that the Aux ports on the new radio aren’t very reliable for limelights.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-21T15:05:03.695Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":152,"readers_count":151,"score":34.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":499984,"topic_slug":"limelights-occasionally-not-connecting-ethernet","display_username":"Clayton Colburn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":34129,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"reactions":[{"id":"open_mouth","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3598577,"name":"","username":"jgarder","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/a183cd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-21T15:15:30.993Z","cooked":"

We struggled with this as well throughout the year. At curie we had the head FTA tell us it is limelights fault because they boot too slow for the robo Rio which is only handing out ip addresses for a limited time. (I have not verified this personally)

This presented itself as a dead port on the vh-109 because no lights would blink on the “dead” port

After a reboot it was almost always ok.

The added network switch still would have had to be connected to one of the aux ports on the radio though, right? (to be able to talk to the RIO, which has to be plugged into RIO port of radio)

You would connect Roborio to the the switch and then connect the switch to the Rio port on the radio.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-21T15:25:18.245Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":112,"readers_count":111,"score":31.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":499984,"topic_slug":"limelights-occasionally-not-connecting-ethernet","display_username":"Clayton Colburn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"aveeser","name":"4391 Programming Mentor","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/3da27b/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":34129,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3598627,"name":"4391 Programming Mentor","username":"aveeser","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/3da27b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-21T15:46:31.576Z","cooked":"

Thanks. I thought is was required that RoboRIO had to be plugged directly into radio, but I must be mistaken. We also battled what seemed to be slow vision pose updates occasionally (only in auton running pathplanner paths, and ONLY when connected to the field). I wonder if adding the switch would have helped us out with that. But all I can do is wonder now … until next season. Thanks for input.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-21T15:46:31.576Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":105,"readers_count":104,"score":35.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":499984,"topic_slug":"limelights-occasionally-not-connecting-ethernet","display_username":"4391 Programming Mentor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"Clayton_Colburn","name":"Clayton Colburn","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/ccd318/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56643,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3598712,"name":"Casey Stahl - 2358 - Robot Repairman (Mentor)","username":"Case0823","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/case0823/{size}/142471_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-21T16:48:25.429Z","cooked":"

We also had those issues but much more frequently. (Plus the bad lightning at WI.)

We had to power cycle the robot several times in some instances. Once it took 3 power cycles on the field. We started powering up at the 20 second mark of the previous match to make sure it was booted as fast as possible so we had time to power cycle if needed. I was checking the cable Everytime too. But that never seemed to be the issue.

We ended up bringing a tag with us to check the camera could see it. Our tech giving us the thumbs up or down and power cycling if not.

Whole thing drove us nuts. I don’t think we ever repeated it in the pit.

Issues last year with an Ethernet switch kept us from adding one in again.

Was this issue only present on FMS?

In my team’s case, no. It was pretty much 5% of the time regardless of where we were (on field or at home). Put all new cabling in twice. This was happening on 2 different cameras with about the same frequency.

Is your RIO configured to have a Static IP?

We had an issue last year with our LimeLight not connecting to our RIO during competitions. It was not resolved and we switched to PV this season, but we noticed that the PV docs recommend a static IP for the RIO which we did not do last year for the LimeLight.

We had this issue as well with static IPs configured on both of our Limelights. A reboot consistently fixed the issue.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-21T18:07:11.188Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":65,"readers_count":64,"score":17.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":499984,"topic_slug":"limelights-occasionally-not-connecting-ethernet","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55818,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3598908,"name":"4391 Programming Mentor","username":"aveeser","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/3da27b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-21T18:46:29.232Z","cooked":"

I feel like a dummy, but I don’t actually know off-hand about the RIO. I guess I thought when configuring team number on RIO that it became a static IP… at 10.xx.xx.2 I believe. Is there another step needed to ensure it is static? Both our limelights are definitely set to static IPs.

Clayton_Colburn:

You would connect Roborio to the the switch and then connect the switch to the Rio port on the radio.

This is an illegal configuration per R703

When this issue occurred, were you able to view the camera feed when accessing the Limelight directly via a web browser?

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-21T18:53:40.043Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":54,"readers_count":53,"score":20.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":499984,"topic_slug":"limelights-occasionally-not-connecting-ethernet","display_username":"Fletcher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"Crafter","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/77aa72/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25039,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between."},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3598927,"name":"Clayton Colburn","username":"Clayton_Colburn","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/ccd318/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-21T18:54:29.307Z","cooked":"

R703 *Use specific Ethernet port for roboRIO. The roboRIO Ethernet port must be connected to the wireless
bridge port labeled “RIO” for VH-109 radios or “18-24v POE” for OpenMesh radios (either directly, via a
network switch, via an RPM, or via a CAT5 Ethernet pigtail).

The rule clearly states in the parentheses that it can be direct or through a network switch.

Clayton_Colburn:

or “18-24v POE” for OpenMesh radios (either directly, via a
network switch, via an RPM, or via a CAT5 Ethernet pigtail).

That’s only when using the OMP5, which is still used in China and Taiwan.

We also had occasional Limelight 4 connection issues upon boot. Restarting the robot always seemingly resolved it.

We used static IPs, the latest firmware, and had the issue with the gateway set to both x.1 (what the official Limelight documentation says) and x.4 (what we were later told the actual right gateway was).
